StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genetic Study on Proteinuria in Type-2 Diabetes
StudyInfo.Description: A collection of patients with type-2 diabetes was collected at the Joslin Diabetes Center. Patients were categorized to a group of cases with diabetic nephropathy, and a group of controls with normoalbuminuria. From these groups, 173 cases and 177 controls were randomly selected for a genome-wide association study.

Header.title: Principal Investigator
Header.Institution: Joslin Diabetes Center, Boston, MA, USA

Header.title: Co-Investigator

Journal.authors: Pezzolesi MG, Poznik GD, Mychaleckyj JC, Dunn JS, Rich SS, Warram JH, Krolewski AS
Journal.title: Genome-wide Association Scans in Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Provide Evidence of a Shared Etiology: Identification of a Common Diabetic Nephropathy Locus on Chromosome 15q

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Search for Susceptibility Genes for Diabetic Nephropathy in Type 1 Diabetes (GoKinD study participants and parents): The GoKinD study was conducted by the GoKinD Investigators and supported by the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK). The data from the GoKinD study reported here were supplied by the GoKinD investigators. This manuscript was not prepared in collaboration with Investigators of the GoKinD study and does not necessarily reflect the opinions or views of the GoKinD study, or the NIDDK.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)
